function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High levels of anxiety and stress among participants in the study, with specific risk factors related to age, sex, income, education, and health status.","Impact":"Increased risk of mental health issues and reduced well-being for affected individuals.","Mitigation":"Provide mental health resources and support for at-risk groups, and promote education and awareness about mental health.","Technologies":"Telemedicine and mental health apps for remote support and counseling.","People":"Participants in the study, particularly those who are younger, have low incomes, and are in poor health.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, mental health organizations, and educational institutions."},{"Description":"Depressive symptoms, anxiety, and PTSD reported among a significant percentage of participants, with associations to sex, mental health history, and exposure to the virus.","Impact":"Negative impact on mental health and well-being, potentially leading to long-term mental health issues.","Mitigation":"Offer mental health interventions, support services, and trauma-informed care for affected individuals.","Technologies":"Teletherapy, online support groups, and digital mental health platforms for accessible care.","People":"Participants in the study, especially those with mental health history, exposure to the virus, and female sex.","Owner":"Mental health professionals, support organizations, and public health agencies."},{"Description":"Differences in mental health outcomes based on age, sex, marital status, and spiritual well-being, with varying levels of risk and protective factors.","Impact":"Unequal mental health outcomes and well-being based on demographic and psychological factors.","Mitigation":"Address social determinants of mental health, provide targeted support for at-risk demographics, and promote holistic well-being.","Technologies":"Online mental health assessments, digital well-being programs, and virtual support networks.","People":"Participants in the study, especially those who are younger, female, unmarried, and with lower spiritual well-being.","Owner":"Community organizations, mental health advocates, and religious/spiritual institutions."}]}
